entities.name: gaunt shack
entities.description: The Gaunt shack is mentioned as a place where something was hidden. It is described as a location that no one had ever known to be related to the narrator, and it is said that he had hidden the connection.

entities.name: ring
entities.description: The ring is mentioned as something that was hidden in the Gaunt shack. It is described as being safe.

entities.name: cave
entities.description: The cave is mentioned as a place that protects the locket. It is said to be inaccessible and its protection is described as strong.

entities.name: loket
entities.description: The locket is mentioned as something that was stolen, but it is also said to be protected by the cave's protection.

entities.name: hagwarts
entities.description: Hogwarts is mentioned as a place where one of the Horcruxes was hidden. The narrator alone knows where it is located, and he has plumbed its deepest secrets.

entities.name: horcrux
entities.description: The Horcrux is mentioned as something that was hidden in Hogwarts. It is said to be one of the things that the narrator must return to and protect.

entities.name: nagini
entities.description: Nagini is mentioned as a person who must remain close to the narrator, but no longer sent to do his bidding. She is under his protection.

entities.name: elder wand
entities.description: The Elder Wand is mentioned as something that the narrator must undertake a quest for alone.

relationships.description: The ring was hidden in the Gaunt shack, as mentioned in the text: 'he had hidden the ring in the Gaunt shack'.
The cave protects the locket, as mentioned in the text: 'the idea of the locket being stolen was absurd... And how could the boy, or anybody else, know about the cave or penetrate its protection?'
One of the Horcruxes was hidden in Hogwarts, as mentioned in the text: 'He alone knew where in Hogwarts he had stowed the Horcrux'.
Nagini is under the narrator's protection, as mentioned in the text: 'And there was still Nagini, who must remain close now, no longer sent to do his bidding, under his protection'.
Inverse of the previous relationship. Nagini is also protected by the narrator.
